items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Gaza aid flotilla says Israeli warships intercepted boats
items.summary: The Global Sumud Flotilla, with Greta Thunberg, Nelson Mandela's grandson, Mandla Mandela, and several European lawmakers aboard, consists of nearly 50 boats and 500 activists.

items.title: Should I use olive oil for frying? How to choose the right cooking oil
items.summary: The choice of oils to cook with can be overwhelming. Here is what to use for frying, drizzling and general cooking.

items.title: Surge in Ukrainian attacks on oil refineries sparks Russian fuel shortages
items.summary: Ukraine has attacked refineries deep inside Russia, with Zelensky vowing to continue the strikes.

items.title: 'I won £65,000 at an employment tribunal – but I've yet to see a penny'
items.summary: A BBC investigation reveals thousands of workers are still missing out on tribunal payouts.

items.title: 'Phenomenal' Odegaard given 'total freedom' to shine
items.summary: Martin Odegaard shows why he is still the key creative figure for Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta and why he has been given "total freedom".

items.title: Hackers delete children's pictures and data after nursery attack backlash
items.summary: The hackers tell the BBC they are sorry for their actions - but experts question say it's a practical rather than moral move.

items.title: Sonam Wangchuk’s wife writes to President Murmu for his release, seeks intervention on ‘witch-hunt’
items.summary: Gitanjali Angmo, in her letter, asked if it was a sin to fight against reckless and unchecked development activities in an ecologically fragile area of Ladakh

items.title: Conservationist Dame Jane Goodall dies aged 91
items.summary: Dr Goodall was a world-leading expert on chimpanzees and a renowned conservationist.

items.title: CJI Gavai's mother Kamala Gavai says she won't attend RSS centenary  function in Maharashtra
items.summary: “If I had been on the dais (at the October 5 RSS function), I would have put forward the Ambedkarite ideology,” Kamala Gavai wrote

items.title: 'Not good enough' - do Man City have a late goal issue?
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said he was not concerned about the late goals being conceded by Manchester City, but his side let in a 90th-minute penalty against Monaco in the Champions League.

items.title: Tejasvi Surya to head parliamentary panel on Jan Vishwas Bill, LS speaker reconstitutes committees
items.summary: BJP leader Baijayant Panda was appointed chairman of the select committee to examine the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code Bill, while the chairpersons of almost all the department-related parliamentary panels, including Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, have been re-nominated to their respective positio

items.title: Ladakh L-G chairs security review meeting, says restrictions to be lifted in a phased manner
items.summary: Kavinder Gupta lauded the relentless efforts of the security forces and the civil administration in restoring normalcy over the past week

items.title: U.S. Supreme Court lets Lisa Cook remain as Federal Reserve Governor for now
items.summary: The court said it would hear arguments in January over President Donald Trump’s effort to force Ms. Cook off the Fed board; White House vows to continue its legal fight

items.title: Newcastle dynamism shows a 'return to best style'
items.summary: Newcastle United record their biggest Champions League win against Union Saint-Gilloise and show they belong at Europe's top table.

items.title: Karur stampede | Government did its part, TVK failed in its duty: DMK’s Senthilbalaji
items.summary: Pointing to a recent DMK “Mupperum Vizha” in Karur, which drew nearly 2.5 lakh people, Mr. Senthilbalaji contrasted the preparations

items.title: Refugees to face longer route to UK settlement rights
items.summary: Details of the new conditions refugees will have to meet are to be set out later in the autumn.

items.title: Late Dier penalty helps Monaco snatch draw against Man City
items.summary: Former Tottenham Hotspur defender Eric Dier wins a dramatic late penalty before converting to seal a 2-2 draw for Monaco against Manchester City in the Champions League.

items.title: Martinelli and Saka lead Arsenal to victory against Olympiacos
items.summary: Goals from Gabriel Martinelli and Bukayo Saka help Arsenal continue their perfect start to the Champions League season as the Gunners secure a 2-0 victory against Olympiakos.

items.title: Dame Jane Goodall revolutionised our understanding of our closest primate cousins
items.summary: Those she inspired say she not only revolutionised our understanding of chimpanzees - but challenged how we relate to the natural world.

items.title: French troops board oil tanker linked to Russian 'shadow fleet'
items.summary: President Emmanuel Macron said the crew had committed "serious offences" but did not directly link the vessel to Russia.

items.title: AIMPLB postpones ‘Bharat Bandh’ against waqf law
items.summary: The AIMPLB said the bandh has been deferred due to religious festivals in several States

items.title: World Cup kick-offs likely to be after midnight in UK due to heat
items.summary: Fifa are likely to schedule World Cup matches involving major European nations after midnight UK time next year in an effort to combat heat issues that affected the recent Club World Cup.

items.title: Touch of Telangana at Bathukamma, Dasara celebrations in Detroit
items.summary: The festivities organised by the Global Telangana Association (GTA) Detroit Chapter witnessed a record-breaking attendance

items.title: Congress reminds PM Modi of Sardar Patel's observations on RSS
Trump signs an executive order vowing to defend Qatar in the wake of Israel's strike
items.summary: The order cites the two countries’ “close cooperation” and “shared interest,” vowing to “guarantee the security and territorial integrity of the state of Qatar against external attack”

items.title: No talks with Maoists, says DGP Shivdhar Reddy while urging them to lay down arms
‘Congress is a party of factions and internal rifts’ says Haryana CM Saini
items.summary: The cooperative societies had lost the trust of farmers during the Congress regime, but our government will work to restore this trust, says Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini

items.title: Cabinet approves ₹11,440 crore mission to make India self-sufficient in pulses
items.summary: The "Mission for Aatmanirbharta in Pulses", approved by the Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will be for the period from 2025-26 to 2030-31

items.title: Part of high-rise apartment building in New York City collapses, no injuries reported
items.summary: The city's fire department said it had no immediate reports of injuries. It said it was responding to a report of a gas explosion that collapsed an incinerator shaft in the 20-story building in the Bronx

items.title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
items.summary: The Union Commerce Minister said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

items.title: Any issue can be resolved only through talks: Ladakh L-G Kavinder Gupta to agitating groups
items.summary: Mr. Gupta lashes out at Rahul Gandhi for his remarks on the Ladakh situation, alleging that the Congress leader was trying to “vitiate the atmosphere” in the country

items.title: Mudslide in southern Nepal claims 4 lives
items.summary: According to locals, while digging soil on the bank of the river with a trowel, a mound of earth collapsed

items.title: Search operation launched after suspicious movement in J&K’s Kathua
items.summary: The search operation was jointly launched by the police and the Border Security Force (BSF) in the area along the Ujh river near the Jhathana village located near the International Border

items.title: At least 36 killed, over 200 injured as church under construction collapses on worshippers in Ethiopia
items.summary: Some people remained under the rubble, local official Atnafu Abate told the Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation (EBC), without giving further details about those trapped or possible rescue efforts

items.title: William event may have been target of Mail publisher blagging, Harry's lawyer says
items.summary: The Duke of Sussex is one of seven high-profile people bringing legal action against Daily Mail publisher.

items.title: Four ways US government shutdown could end
items.summary: At some point, public pressure and political pain will see one side yield to bring this latest US government shutdown to an end.

items.title: Taliban government in Afghanistan rejects reports of nationwide internet ban
items.summary: There is nothing like the rumours being spread that we have imposed a ban on the internet, Taliban officials said in a three-line statement shared in a WhatsApp chat group with Pakistani journalists

items.title: Top news of the day: PM unveils ₹100 coin, stamp at RSS centenary; TVK postpones Vijay’s Saturday rallies in the wake of Karur stampede, and more
items.summary: The major news headlines of the day and more.

items.title: Watch: What happened on September 27, the night of the stampede in Karur? | Reporter’s Diary
items.summary: What began as routine political rally by actor-turned politician Vijay’s TVK in Karur soon spiralled into chaos and at least 41 people died in a stampede. The Hindu’s C. Jaisankar was on the ground that fateful day. This is his first-hand account of how the tragedy unfolded.

items.title: Mortar shell defused along LoC in J&K’s Rajouri
items.summary: The shell is believed to have landed in the village from across the border during cross-border shelling during Operation Sindoor in May

items.title: GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in September
items.summary: The GST collections were 9.1% higher than the same month a year ago and over 1.5% higher than the previous month

items.title: India welcome to collect Asia Cup trophy from me at ACC office in Dubai: Mohsin Naqvi
items.summary: In a post on X, Mr. Naqvi rejected reports claiming that he, at the ACC AGM on Tuesday (September 30), apologised to BCCI officials for his actions at the presentation ceremony

items.title: Afghans rejoice as internet returns after Taliban blackout
items.summary: A 48-hour shutdown imposed by the Taliban government hit firms, flights and risked further isolating women.

items.title: Chunk of NYC building collapses in possible explosion
items.summary: No one was injured and no apartments were damaged, although some residents were evacuated.

items.title: Bareilly violence: 2 'outsiders' with criminal history nabbed after gunfight with police
items.summary: District Magistrate Avinash Singh on Wednesday (October 1) said nearly 80 accused have been identified in the case, and arms licences of half a dozen people are being cancelled.

items.title: PM unveils ₹100 coin, stamp at RSS centenary; first-ever depiction of Bharat Mata on Indian currency
items.summary: In the mission of building a developed India by 2047, the contribution of the Sangh will be crucial, said PM Modi.

items.title: AIADMK MLA joins villagers opposing entry of fireworks unit in Thirumangalam; says it will spoil eco-system
items.summary: AIADMK MLA and Deputy Leader in the Assembly R.B. Udayakumar said that the villagers had submitted petitions to the Madurai Collector appealing to stop giving licence to the fireworks unit

items.title: Dowry cases rise by 14% in 2023; over 6,100 women killed: NCRB
items.summary: Uttar Pradesh again topped the chart with 2,122 deaths, followed by Bihar with 1,143. Dowry was listed as the motive in 833 murder cases across the country in 2023

items.title: Why BBC sent undercover reporter into a busy London police station
items.summary: A BBC reporter describes secretly filming misogynistic and racist attitudes among serving Metropolitan Police officers.

items.title: Unmasked: Secret BBC filming exposes hidden culture of misogyny and racism inside Met Police
items.summary: Panorama undercover investigation captures evidence that "toxic behaviours", far from being driven out of the Met, have been driven underground.

items.title: Pope Leo condemns climate change critics
items.summary: In his first major statement on climate change, the pontiff criticises those who minimise climate change.

items.title: Civic notice to school for 'ban' on religious, cultural symbols
items.summary: The controversy erupted after some parents raised objections over students being prohibited from wearing 'tilak' or 'tikli' (bindi) on their foreheads, bangles, and rakhi or sacred threads.

items.title: Three workers from Theni killed in Idukki district due to asphyxiation while cleaning septic tank in a hotel
items.summary: Police said that the workers were hired by a private hotel in Kattapanai in Idukki district, Kerala

items.title: 150 years of national song ‘Vande Mataram’ to be celebrated across India: Union Cabinet
items.summary: Briefing reporters on the decisions taken by the Union Cabinet, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that keeping in mind the role played by the song during the freedom struggle, a decision was taken to hold country-wide celebrations to mark its 150th year.

items.title: MP released water for irrigation from PTR canal; to benefit over 10000 acres of cultivable land in Theni district
items.summary: Tamilselvan appealed to the farmers’ to make judicious use of the water and reap high yields

items.title: Israel 'tightens siege' of Gaza City as Hamas reviews Trump peace plan
items.summary: The defence minister warns Palestinians to leave, saying those remaining will be considered "terrorists and supporters of terror".

items.title: Rajesh Agrawal takes charge as Commerce Secretary
items.summary: Rajesh Agrawal was the chief negotiator for the India-U.S. Bilateral Trade Agreement, Indo-Pacific Economic Forum, India-Australia CECA, and review of the ASEAN FTA

items.title: Cabinet gives approval to 57 new Kendriya Vidyalayas
items.summary: Seven will be sponsored by the Union Home Ministry, and the rest by State governments.

items.title: Cabinet hikes wheat MSP by ₹160 per quintal to ₹2,585
items.summary: The MSP has been decided based on the recommendations of the Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP), says Information and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

items.title: Congress did protest Rahul death threat, CPI(M) ministers 'mistaken': LoP Satheesan
items.summary: Satheesan said that the threat by the BJP leader, Printu Mahadevan, was made on a news channel on September 26

items.title: Centre hikes Dearness Allowance/Dearness Relief by 3%; to benefit 1.18 crore employees, pensioners
items.summary: The DA/DR increase of 3% over the existing rate of 55% of the basic pay/pension to compensate against the price rise is effective July 1, 2025

items.title: Former Punjab Minister Anil Joshi joins Congress
items.summary: Anil Joshi’s joining came days after he met Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and party general secretary (organisation) K.C. Venugopal in Delhi

items.title: Ennore building collapse: PMK demands inquiry, seeks compensation for victims
items.summary: The building, under construction at the Ennore Thermal Power Station in North Chennai, collapsed on September 30, claiming the lives of nine migrant workers, all hailing from Assam

items.title: TVK postpones Vijay’s Saturday rallies in the wake of Karur stampede
items.summary: In a social media update, the party’s official handle pointed out to the Karur tragedy and said “we are in anguish and regret over the loss of 41 of our brethren”

items.title: No proposal to levy charges on UPI transactions: RBI Governor Malhotra
items.summary: The Governor said the central bank is examining a proposal to allow lenders to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit in case of default in EMI payments

items.title: 'Focus and reset' - the bracelets keeping Bell on track
items.summary: England seamer Lauren Bell tells BBC Sport about preparing for her first 50-over World Cup and how wearing home-made bracelets gets the best out of her.

items.title: ‘Kantara Chapter 1’: What to expect from Rishab Shetty’s big prequel | Commentary
items.summary: A video analysis on the success of the film ‘Kantara’ and what to expect from its prequel.

items.title: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party submits memorandum to Bihar Governor for Deputy CM's removal
items.summary: A delegation of the fledgling party, headed by national president Uday Singh and State unit chief Manoj Bharti, visited Raj Bhavan late Tuesday evening

items.title: Pope Leo XIV urges Hamas to accept Trump's peace plan for Gaza
items.summary: Pope Leo expresses concern about the fate of the flotilla bringing aid to Gaza

items.title: Munich Oktoberfest fairgrounds closed after bomb threat and deadly explosion; atleast 1 dead
items.summary: Police searches the fairgrounds for other explosive devices and asks workers to leave the area

items.title: Police detain Congress MP, SP MLA at house to prevent from visiting Bareilly
items.summary: The two leaders were scheduled to travel to the city by an early morning train to meet some police officers, but were confined to their residences

items.title: Baroness Mone-linked company ordered to pay £122m over PPE contract
items.summary: The government wins its case against PPE Medpro - part of a consortium led by Baroness Mone's husband - after it supplied non-compliant gowns in 2020.

items.title: Government issues new data demand for UK Apple users
items.summary: It is the latest development in a privacy row which has pitted the UK against the tech giant and the Trump administration.

items.title: Was Starmer right to link Brexit to a rise in small boat crossings?
items.summary: Keir Starmer has linked the rise in small boat arrivals to Brexit, describing the crossings as "Farage boats".

items.title: Arunachal Pradesh Congress demands apology from BJP over 'death threat' to Rahul Gandhi
items.summary: "This is not just an irresponsible remark, but a criminal act of intimidation," APCC president Bosiram Siram said

items.title: How to attract birds, butterflies and other beings? - Experts suggest measures as HYDRAA rejuvenates Hyderabad’s lakes
items.summary: People working towards documenting and restoration of biodiversity, urged authorities undertaking lake rejuvenation to take proactive measures to restore biodiversity

items.title: India wasted opportunity to give befitting reply to Pakistan after Pahalgam terror attack: Owaisi
items.summary: Asaduddin Owaisi says an atmosphere of war had prevailed as drones launched by Pakistan hovered over the western borders from Gujarat to Kashmir

items.title: U.S. senators reintroduce Bill to reform H-1B, L-1 visa rules as Donald Trump fee fuels scrutiny
items.summary: Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley and Democratic ranking member Dick Durbin of Illinois said the Bill tightens rules by raising wage and hiring standards

items.title: PM Modi's silence on atrocities in Gaza 'total betrayal' of what India has stood for: Congress
items.summary: "Where is the accountability for the genocide that has been carried out in Gaza over the past twenty months?" Jairam Ramesh said

items.title: Shivadhar Reddy assumes charge as new DGP of Telangana

Rochdale grooming gang ringleader jailed for 35 years
items.summary: Two girls were repeatedly raped and assaulted from the age of 13 in the Greater Manchester town.

items.title: Odisha districts on alert as IMD forecasts heavy rain till October 5 owing to low pressure over Bay of Bengal
items.summary: For October 2, it has issued a ‘Red’ warning of above 20-cm rainfall in Puri and Jagstingpur districts, an ‘Orange’ warning (7 cm to 20 cm rain) for 14 districts, and a ‘Yellow’ warning (7 cm to 11 cm rain) for the remaining 14 districts

items.title: Contractor booked in building collapse incident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin expressed grief over the incident; the nine victims hail from Assam

items.title: Watch: PM Modi unveils RSS centenary stamp and coin
Major General G. Srinivas, who oversaw logistics in Operation Sindoor, takes charge as CDM Commandant
items.summary: Before his appointment, Major General Srinivas was entrusted with the planning and execution of operational logistics in the Western Command theatre, including during the recent Operation Sindoor

items.title: Stock markets extend morning gains post RBI policy; sensex jumps nearly 600 points
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on October 1 kept its policy interest rate unchanged at 5.5% for the second consecutive time, citing concerns over tariff uncertainties

items.title: Mid-air scuffle with Uttar Pradesh MLA lands passenger in police custody
items.summary: The incident happened on Air India flight when MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh objected to a passenger, Samad Ali, allegedly using foul language while talking on the phone

items.title: Sudanese city under siege: 'My son's whole body is full of shrapnel'
items.summary: Civilians pay the price as paramilitary fighters intensify their offensive to take full control of el-Fasher.

items.summary: Here’s what to know about the U.S. Government shutdown

items.title: PM Modi hails RSS’ role in nation-building, says it showed no bitterness despite attacks
items.summary: PM Narendra Modi releases special postage stamp and coin to commemorate 100 years of RSS

items.title: Congo military court sentences former President Joseph Kabila to death for treason
items.summary: Kabila was accused of treason, involvement in an insurrection movement, conspiracy, and supporting terrorism

items.title: Storm Amy named with 80mph winds and severe weather warnings for the UK
items.summary: Simon King looks at what impacts Storm Amy, the first named storm of the season, will bring at the end of the week.

items.title: Anu Kalikal’s exhibition in Thiruvananthapuram captures her battle with mental health issues
items.summary: The exhibition, Lines of Flight, is on till October 10 at Alliance Française de Trivandrum

items.title: Hamas pressured from all sides as it weighs Trump's Gaza plan
items.summary: Hamas was not involved in the negotiations that led to Donald Trump's plan, which calls on the Islamist militant group to disarm, a demand it has previously rejected

items.title: Police close probe into stone attack on Anil Deshmukh; leader alleges pressure
items.summary: The former Maharashtra Home Minister claimed the police were under pressure and the incident was being given a political colour

items.title: Watch: 91 students still trapped after Indonesia school collapse
items.summary: At least ninety-one students remained still trapped beneath the rubble nearly two days after the collapse of the al Khoziny Islamic boarding school in East Java, Indonesia. Officials confirmed three students dead and around one hundred injured, while more than three hundred rescuers continued desper

items.title: Watch: Pentagon chief wants ‘highest male standard’ for combat roles.
MPC keeps repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, revises growth forecast upwards to 6.8%, inflation projected at 2.6%for FY26
items.summary: Consequently, the standing deposit facility (SDF) rate remains at 5.25% while the marginal standing facility (MSF) rate and the Bank Rate remain at 5.75%
